intro: Tridactyle flabellata, commonly known as the flabellate tridactyle, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it prefers a subtropical climate.
